Todayâ€™s Events Daily Event Calendar Submit an Event New Events Calendar Seasonal Falls, Fairs, and Festivals Guide Oktoberfest Guide Halloween Event Guide Pumpkin Patch Guide Corn Maze Guide Fall Consignment Sales End of Summer Deals Outdoor Movie Guide School Calendar Guide News Latest Family Event News News Categories Family Events Steals and Deals Outdoor Fun & Events Indoor Fun & Events Theme Parks News & Events Music & Theater Events Free Events Event Daily Calendar Event Reviews Giveaways Website Guide Family Guides All Family Guides Parks and Playground Guide Library Guide Zoo and Animal Guide Museum Guide School Calendars Kidâ€™s Theater Guide Indoor Playground Guide Farmerâ€™s Market Guide Race and Walk Guide Kids Expo Exhibitor Information More Contact Us Advertise Social Facebook Instagram TikTok YouTube Facebook Group Submit Submit an Event Feature Your Event Submit Press Release Summer Camp Guide Info Summer Camp Guide Advertising Summer Camp Media Kit 2025 Summer Camp Guide Submit Summer Camp Facebook Instagram TikTok Youtube Orlando Family Events Calendar â€“ Things to Do with Kids in Central Florida Discover the Orlando Family Events Calendar , your go-to guide for things to do with kids and families in Central Florida. From exciting Orlando festivals, family-friendly fairs, and seasonal holiday events to local story times, free community activities, and weekend fun across Orange, Seminole, Osceola, Lake, and Volusia counties, our calendar makes it easy to plan memorable outings. Whether youâ€™re looking for kid-friendly events, indoor play, outdoor adventures, or special attractions like theme park happenings, our Central Florida events calendar Images by Blue Sunglass Photos With our Orlando Family Events Calendar , you can easily filter events by category to find exactly what fits your familyâ€™s needs. Browse holiday celebrations, free and low-cost events, back-to-school activities, seasonal festivals, and so much more. You can also filter by venue, city, cost, or even check out our featured events to quickly discover whatâ€™s happening near you. You can view listings by the day to plan their schedule, flip through different days to explore new opportunities, or switch to the monthly calendar view for a big-picture look at everything happening across Orlando and Central Florida. If youâ€™re hosting a family-friendly event, you can even submit it directly to our calendar here . Want to have events and news deliverd to your inbox, click here to sign up for our weekly newsletters! Be sure to always double and triple check dates, times, and details of any event before heading out, as event producers may make last-minute changes without notifying us, and occasional errors may occur when loading events into the calendar. Â« Baldwin Park Community Market Winter Park Village Block Party Â» Springtoberfest at the German-American Society of Central Florida 04/13/2024 @ 12:00 pm - 10:00 pm ğ’ğ©ğ«ğ¢ğ§ğ ğ­ğ¨ğ›ğğ«ğŸğğ¬ğ­!! Join Hollerbachâ€™s in celebrating ğ¹ğ‘Ÿğ‘¢Ìˆâ„ğ‘™ğ‘–ğ‘›ğ‘” in the Biergarten at the German-American Society of Central Florida in Casselberry from Noon to 10:00 pm for beer on tap from German breweries and great German food, including a special booth from Hollerbachâ€™s German Restaurant! Celebrate with live music and dancing all day long, both outside in the Biergarten and inside the Clubhouse. Traditional Flag Parade at 5:30 PM. Not a beer drinker? Weâ€™ve got you covered (literally) with a full-service bar in our air-conditioned Alpine-themed Clubhouse. All this adds up to the very best in ğ˜ğ˜¦ğ˜®ğ˜¶Ìˆğ˜µğ˜­ğ˜ªğ˜¤ğ˜©ğ˜¬ğ˜¦ğ˜ªğ˜µ, the warm feeling of comfort, cheer and camaraderie when sharing great food, drink, music and atmosphere with friends and family. So raise your beer Steins high in a German toastâ€ Zicke-Zacke, Zicke-Zacke Zicke-Zacke HOI HI HOI! Und Prost! General Admission Tickets: Advance purchase on Eventbrite: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/springtoberfest-2024-tickets-855450965867 Gate admission to Orlandoâ€™s most Authentic German Beer Fest: $5 Advance Purchase or at the gate OrlandoGermanClub.com Children below the age of 12 enter for FREE Free admission with valid ID showing status: Active Police, Active Fire, Active Duty Military with Valid ID showing status required at the Entrance Gate. Please claim your FREE ticket online. There is no need to print out your tickets, unless you have large parties and are not arriving at the same time. We can scan the ticket on your cell phone. Parking: Parking is available for a fee in the lot at the end of Orange Lane (this lot is not part of our club). Surrounding businesses/home owners will offer parking for a fee on nearby streets. Please do not park illegally or block driveways, your car might be towed, at your expense, or ticketed by the Sherriffâ€™s Office/Casselberry Police. Refund: Sorry, no refunds on Admission Tickets. The net profit from this event is to benefit the programs of the German American Society of Central Florida (GASOCF), a Non-Profit Organization (501c3). Check us out at OrlandoGermanClub.com Please share and â€œlikeâ€ us on Facebook See you there! Prost! German American Society of Central Florida (GASOCF) 381 Orange Lane, Casselberry, FL 32707 Add to calendar Google Calendar iCalendar Outlook 365 Outlook Live Details Date: 04/13/2024 Time: 12:00 pm - 10:00 pm More Information https://www.facebook.com/events/1100459757676884/ Venue German American Society of Central Florida 381 Orange Lane Casselberry , FL 32707 United States View Venue Website Related Events Baby Babbles at Maitland Library September 11 @ 10:30 am - 11:00 am Town of Oakland Story Time on the Porch September 11 @ 10:30 am - 11:00 am Youth Workshop at The Kitchen House September 11 @ 10:30 am - 1:00 pm Â« Baldwin Park Community Market Winter Park Village Block Party Â» Thank you for visiting us at MyCentralFloridaFamily.com. We're happy you're here! This website was designed to assist families with finding resources, ideas and things to do within the Central Florida community. We encourage all families to check and double check all events, information and news prior to making decisions for their families because, while we strive for perfection, information, news, events, and details always will and do change. Our website contains paid, non-paid, and in-trade mentions, articles, and reviews of organizations, events, schools and businesses throughout Central Florida. These mentions are for informational purposes only and should not be considered an endorsement. Please do further research on your own before choosing an event, organization, school or business to engage with. Families and individuals using our site assume all risks from any activities they participate in. MyCentralFloridaFamily.com, Epic Expos, Inc., their employees and owners are not responsible for any injuries or issues that come from participating in any of the events or opportunities listed on our website or social pages. All users/readers/visitors to MyCentralFloridaFamily.com agree to hold Epic Expos, Inc. and all of it's entities harmless in any such claims. With that said, we hope you find our website and social pages full of fun ideas and opportunities to make family memories and make your Central Florida living easier than ever. German Festival Florida | About Us | The American German Club Ã¯ÂŠÂ½ Member Login Home event calendar about Venue Rental News Alerts Photo Gallery Directions To The Club For Reservations / Tickets 561-967-6464 oktoberfest membership contact Home event calendar about us Catering News alerts Photo Gallery Donation Fund Directions to club oktoberfest membership contact Ã¯ÂŠÂ½ Member Login Ã¯ÂŠÂ½ Member Login For Reservations / Tickets 561-967-6464 about us history of the club In the Spring of 1967, three good friends: Richard Blechschmidt, Gerold Harbeke, and Karl-Heinz Randtke, dreamed of forming a club here in Palm Beach County that would be a social center for local peoples of German heritage. They called it the "Bavarian American Club". The purpose of this club would be to uphold and promote the ethnic background common to them within the framework of the U.S.A.The name was later changed from the "Bavarian American Club" to the"American German Club", which was approved in Tallahassee in June of 1970. Their ideas took hold in and attracted people from the local area who also wanted to have a little bit of the "Alte Heimat" here in Florida. There were many impromptu gatherings and meetings in stores, restaurants, and other facilities as the group grew larger in number and greater in their determination to realize this common goal. Funds were obtained, land was purchased, and the vision started to become a reality. The picnic grounds were our first real home, and in 1975 ground was broken for the new clubhouse; the new building was designed in the authentic Bavarian style. Members helped dig, pour concrete, donated supplies and money, and even bought cement blocks at a dollar each. Members of our club who were taught traditional techniques in Germany, have beautifully handcrafted the interior of the building, making the construction a lengthy process. By 1974 the Club had grown rapidly in membership, and in 1983 had reached a total of 550 members. The Annual American German Club Oktoberfest was first held in 1974. Each year during the month of October, members outdo themselves in time and talent by presenting to the community an Oktoberfest for all to enjoy. There are authentic German food specialties along with beer and wine for all to taste as well. Entertainment has been brought directly from Germany since its inception, and we plan to keep this tradition alive each year in October by inviting people of all cultures to come and see what "GemÃƒÂ¼tlichkeit" is all about. A beautiful club facility such as ours is now, takes a great deal of money, much effort, and good inspired leadership to become a reality, as we still have more goals to achieve and more dreams for the future. We have the opportunity of a lifetime to demonstrate the tremendous contributions that German-Americans have made over the past 300 years to this great nation. We can help bring enrichment and harmony to the community as a whole, and we welcome friendly folks of all cultures. Today, we are a multicultural and diverse membership, welcome guests from all over the world to participate. Founders mission statement The American German Club strives to promote: The Cultural Value of German Customs, such as Dress, Food and Drink, Language, Craftsmanship, Athletics, Entertainment and Travel. Opportunities for Good Fellowship Ã¢Â€Â˜GemÃƒÂ¼tlichkeitÃ¢Â€Â™, through German Cultural Events such as Festivals, Concerts, Dances and Sports. Preservation of German Cultural Artifacts for Future Generations. Education of the Public of Palm Beach County concerning contributions by the German People to the American Heritage. Give back to the Community We give back to our community through donations to various charities of our choosing as well as partnership with other not-for-profit organizations for fundraising. Officers and Appointed Positions Mark Luft , President president@americangermanclub.org Doug Christensen , VP vicepresident@americangermanclub.org Jay Vollstedt, Membership membership@americangermanclub.org Jay Vollstedt, Secretary secretary@americangermanclub.org Holger Van Deun, Venue Rental rental@americangermanclub.org Clubs within our Club Schuetzenverein (Sharpshooters) This club meets and practices throughout the year with Olympic style pellet guns and competes annually against other clubs. Volkstanzgruppe Is a folk dance group who perform at festivals and at private events upon request. Email For More Information Heimatklange A choral group that performs traditional German songs. Stern des Suedens South Florida The official fan club of FC Bayern Munich. Facebook Fan Page If you want to partner with our club by offering a sponsorship at our events or to our member newsletter, please contact info@americangermanclub.org. If youâ€™d like to help support our ongoing repairs and improvements, you can! For every donation of $100, weâ€™ll place your name on a plaque on the fence panel you donated! OR email us: contact@orlandogermanclub.com If your name is not on our master list, you donâ€™t have a dinner reservation!Â  Walk-inâ€™s (without dinner) always welcome. Menu Toggle German Food Music Dancing Clothing Events and Festivals Dinner Dance About Menu Toggle History of the Club Article Lake Mary Life Magazine Clubs & Affiliates Menu Toggle German Clubs in Florida and the USA Events Menu Toggle Great American Big Band Venue Rental Contact Menu Toggle Directions Donations Jobs Privacy Policy Join MEMBER LOGIN Clubs & Affiliates connect and get involved Whatever your passion, we have a place for it. Our established clubs and affiliate clubs offer something for everyone, whether it be German dancing or Karneval festivities. Getting involved in clubs is a great way to connect with other members, and maybe learn a thing or two in the process. Donâ€™t worry, no experience is necessary to join any of our clubs. Our clubs Karneval Gesellschaft Rot/Weiss We celebrate the German tradition of the Karneval Season, which runs from November 11th each year through what is known as â€œFat Tuesdayâ€ in New Orleans, which is the official end of Mardi Gras. The Season begins with the Proclamation Ball (with the appointing of a Royal Prince and Princess), the Costume Ball, the Narrensitzung (Court of Fools) and Rosen Montag (where we bury the â€œSpiritâ€ of Karneval.) Learn more Razzle Dazzle Dance Group Our ladies dance group performs at club events. We do varied routines to Jazz, Pop and Rock & Roll and our group is geared towards fabulous ladies over 50. For more information contact: razzledazzle@orlandogermanclub.com Affiliate clubs Schuhplattler Gruppe Alpenrose We are a German dance group (Schuhplattler Gruppe) based in the Orlando area. Founded in 1980, our German dancers perform throughout the state but mostly in Central Florida. Our mission is to create and foster among our members a genuine love for Alpine traditions and customs, Schuhplattler folk dances and comradeship. For more information contact: GermanDancingOrlando@gmail.com Visit site Central Florida Accordion Club CFAC is a not-for-profit organization, established in 2002, whose purpose is to promote the accordion, encourage accordion players, and maintain public interest in accordion music. We have members who play music in all genres, and with various levels of skill from beginner to highly accomplished. Membership is open to students, hobby players, professionals, instructors--also to enthusiasts even if they don't play. Visit site The Big Band Era is back, brought to life by Bennett Harmon and The Great American Big Band (a 501c3). With our vintage 40â€™s orchestra, we will transport you toÂ an eraÂ when America was producing some of the greatest music of all time! Hear the music of Glenn Miller, Gene Krupa, Benny Goodman, Artie Shaw, Woody Herman, Cab Calloway and many others all together on one stage. The Orlando Big Band is a full 20 piece orchestra that perfectly recreates that true 40â€™s big band sound. Our â€œAndrews Sistersâ€ will take you back to those Boogie Woogie days. Orlando Big Band will host monthly Swing Dances at the German American Society.Â  Check your calendar for dates. Band Preservation is an affiliate nonprofit organization with Orlando Big Band. Our programs involve new young musicians through educational outreach; assist aspiring musicians in need of instruments; offer monetary gifts to the arts and reach a wide segment of the Arts community including dance, instrumental, classical and vocal. 381 Orange Lane, Casselberry, FL 32707    |  Email: See Contact Form |  407-834-0574 Copyright 2024 / The German American Society of Central Florida is a non-profit organization dedicated to preserving and celebrating German culture and traditions.
